title: How could a subterranean alien life form develop space travel? - Quora

response.answer_text: If it were subterranean, what initially would cause it to be so? If it had evolved such a living habit, would it have developed high intelligence sufficient for advanced travel? For the question one must asssume so. However, I can imagine that if an advanced civilisation had gone underground to, say, escape punishing levels of solar radiation, then there could be a strong compulsion to escape such an environmental ‘hell’ - via an escape from that solar system? But, if we rewind for a moment - for an evolving species, that hadn’t yet reached a stage equivalent to the emergence of intelligence, while also being subterranean, we need to understand ‘what’ makes it a subterranean species in the first place? If we viewed analogies in reverse … what would make a ‘terrestrial surface’ species turn to becoming subterranean? That’s an awfully big evolutionary swerve. And in overall proportions, there are very few advanced animal species on Earth that have adapted as to specialise for an underground existence. What I’m saying here, in conclusion, is that it’s an unimaginably big assumption that a NATURALLY subterranean one would change its ways, once developed.
Well, they’d have to dig upwards first, discover for the very first time there’s space, and then use tunnels to launch into space, after finding out how other stuff works, general science.
